page.title: 14MANOR FARM
page.content: The farm is run by the family and an agricultural student, with part time labour when necessary. There are 460 acres in all; the soil is heavy clay on chalk. The grass (335 acres) supports a herd of 145 Friesian cows with 70 followers; a Hereford bull is kept for breeding. Also 320 (soon 600) ewes and 6 Suffolk rams. Lambs bred for meat. Outside labour for shearing etc. Woodland: 80 acres - 3-4 acres plantation, oaks preferred to conifers. Used for pheasants. Headlands left unploughed for partridge; owls welcomed in barns. No badgers, foxes shot. Footpaths respected. Farmhouse and barn grade 2 listed buildings.
